channel.title: CASology on Nancy's Creative Mess
channel.description: Recent content in CASology on Nancy's Creative Mess

item.title: *CASology #408*
item.description: It is with some sadness that I am here with the final challenge at CASology... after many years of wonderful clean and simple challenges, Melissa has decided it is time to retire the CASology Challenge. I think it would be an awesome send off to have a lot of cards submitted for this final challenge… an awesome tribute to a great challenge and to a great team of inspiring CAS creators.

item.title: *CASology #407*
item.description: It’s the first Tuesday of the month which means there is a new CASology challenge. Our cue for this month is HAPPY! The cue is easy for me as the majority of the cards I make are for birthdays… I pulled out some rainbow colours and an alphabet die set and created this for you! Card Info *Cardstock: Stampin’ Up! Basic Black, Poppy Parade, Daffodil Delight, Granny Apple Green, Pacific Point, Highland Heather

item.title: *CASology #406*
item.description: It’s time for a new challenge at CASology and the cue for this month is SAND. I hope you’ll check out what the rest of the design team has created and maybe even share a creation of your own!! You’ll find the CASology blog HERE Despite loving the beach, I don’t have a lot of a things that are beach themed… so I had to think about how to create something with this cue.

item.title: *CASology #405*
item.description: It’s time for a new challenge at CASology... our cue for you for July is WINDY. I have a funny wind story… last fall we put up some security cameras over our garage. Since the trees have leafed this year, we often get alerts from the cameras of “motion”… the other day we had hundreds of alerts in the morning when we work up… each one of them was the leaves on the trees thanks to the wind!

item.title: *CASology #404*
item.description: It’s time for a new challenge at CASology… I hope you’ll pop by the blog to see what the rest of the design team has done with the cue of RIDE. We love to see your clean and simple creations too… share them HERE! I almost skipped this challenge but then remembered this cute set from My Favorite Things and decided I’d give it a go. It’s not really my “style” but I’m glad I pushed myself a little.

item.title: *CASology #403*
item.description: Happy Tuesday creative friends… I saw my surgeon yesterday and as expected, the plaster splint was removed and I now have a removable brace. I can wear the brace when I’m up and about or if the arm/wrist is fatigued. I have some stretches thatI’ve started doing that are really tough but I am told it will all get easier… I am to use my arm and wrist as tolerated for anything non-weight bearing.

item.title: *CASology #402*
item.description: I’m back with the design team at CASology for our April challenge. There are a lot of wonderful cards by the design team to see, so I hope you’ll head to the blog to see them! We’d love to see what you create as well! Share your creations with us HERE! When I saw the cue card for this challenge, my mind automatically went to animals…. but honestly, I’ve made a lot of cards with animals on them in the last little bit and I was a little tired of them.
